headline.main: NEW $4,000,000 HOTEL NEAR TIMES SQUARE; Syndicate Soon to Begin the Construction of a Skyscraper at 7th Ave. and 37th Street.

docs.abstract: Syndicate to build $4-million hotel, 7th Av-37th St, NYC; to be tallest in NY
docs.lead_paragraph: With the announcement yesterday that a syndicate of bankers and realty operators are preparing to spend $4,000,000 in the erection of a twenty-four-story hotel on the northeast corner of Seventh Avenue and Thirty-seventh Street comes the first visible evidence of the long-awaited development of Seventh Avenue in the blocks between the new Pennsylvania Station, at Thirty-second Street, and Times Square.

docs.abstract: to be known as Hotel Oliver; some investors listed

docs.lead_paragraph: Santa Claus and the Child Mind. headline.main: PAY-AS-YOU-ENTER NEW HOTEL'S RULE; R.P. Murphy of the Albany Plans a 20-Story 1,500-Room Hostelry Near Times Square.

docs.abstract: $8-million hostelry planned for Times Sq area
docs.lead_paragraph: Plans are under way for erecting on Broadway near Times Square what the promoters term a "popular hotel," where rooms with bath may be had for $1.50 a day, and patrons will pay as they register. The hotel is to occupy the block front on Broadway between Fortieth and Forty-first Street on the east side.

headline.main: RAISE $5,000 FOR IRELAND.; Irish League Hears T.P. O'Connor Plead for Parliamentary Party.

docs.abstract: NYC hotels weigh installing small chapels because of popularity of hotel weddings
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Municipal Council of the United Irish League gave a reception to T.P. O'Connor, M.P.; Capt. Edward O'Meagher Condon, and John O'Callaghan, National Secretary of the United Irish League, at the Lyric Theatre last night. The meeting was principally for the purpose of raising money to help Ireland in the coming general election.

headline.main: PLAN TO ELIMINATE RAINES LAW HOTELS; Bill Outlined to Hughes Requires That They Shall Have 25 Inhabitants. PERMITS SUNDAY OPENING But Saloons Must Pay an Additional License Fee Of One-Quarter of the Present Fee.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: Com of 14 drafts bill to be introduced by Sen A Brough to eliminate Raines Law hotels
docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, March 11. -- Opponents of the liquor traffic in and out of the Legislature will hardly present a solid front in favor of a bill which was outlined to-day to Gov. Hughes by a delegation from the Committee of Fourteen of the New York City organization formed several years ago for the purpose of eliminating the Raines law hotels as a feature of city life.

headline.main: PLAN NEW BROADWAY HOTEL.; Capitalists and Hotel Men Discuss One for the Times Square District.

docs.abstract: New hotel may be built on Bway, NYC
docs.lead_paragraph: A new hotel, combining the most up-to-date features and conveniences of the Waldorf-Astoria, the St. Regis, the Knickerbocker, and the Plaza, to be located on Broadway, between Forty-second and Fifty-ninth Streets, was said last night by P.C. Geier, assistant manager of the Hotel Knickerbocker, to be a possibility in the near future.

headline.main: PROHIBITS REVOLVING DOORS.; Their Use Forbidden in Large Paris Restaurants and Other Places.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.abstract: Paris police prefect Lepine orders revolving doors at cafes, restaurants and hotels removed; cites danger of doors in emergencies such as fire
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, May 20. -- M. Lepine, Prefect of the Paris police, issued an order today prohibiting the use of revolving doors at all cafes, resturants, hotels, and other places capable of containing more than 100 persons at one time.
docs.snippet: PARIS, May 20. -- M. Lepine, Prefect of the Paris police, issued an order today prohibiting the use of revolving doors at all cafes, resturants, hotels, and other places capable of containing more than 100 persons at one time....

headline.main: HORSEWHIPPED HER IN THE MARTHA WASHINGTON; Angry Brunette Finds Blonde She Followed from Chicago. WOMEN'S HOTEL IS UPSET Man in the Case Quietly Disappears at the Suggestion of Impending Trouble.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sweetly peaceful atmosphere of the Martha Washington Hotel was rudely disturbed yesterday by a real old-fashioned horsewhipping, in which the principals were two women, one -- she with the lash -- being a muscular brunette, and her victim a petite and soft-eyed blonde.

headline.main: WEST END HOTEL AT AUCTION.; Famous Long Branch Hostelry Brings $142,000, and Is Quickly Resold.
